results.title: Cardiovascular effects of dl-nebivolol and its enantiomers--a comparison with those of atenolol.
results.text_hl: The cardiovascular profile of the d-enantiomer is similar to that of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, albeit that its depressant effect on left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ function occurs at higher doses.

citations.NLM: Van de Water A, Xhonneux R, Reneman RS, Janssen PA. Cardiovascular effects of dl-nebivolol and its enantiomers--a comparison with those of atenolol. Eur J Pharmacol. 1988 Oct 26;156(1):95-103. PMID: 3208842
citations.BibTeX: @article{3208842, title={Cardiovascular effects of dl-nebivolol and its enantiomers--a comparison with those of atenolol.}, author={Van de Water A and Xhonneux R and Reneman RS and Janssen PA}, journal={Eur J Pharmacol}, volume={156}, number={1}, pages={95-103}}

results.title: Prevention of ventricular fibrillation requires central beta-adrenoceptor blockade in rabbits.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: The incidence of postocclusion @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@VF@@@ in @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ animals was lower (p<0.05) than that in @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ or control animals.

citations.NLM: Ablad B, Bjurö T, Björkman JA, Edström T. Prevention of ventricular fibrillation requires central beta-adrenoceptor blockade in rabbits. Scand Cardiovasc J. 2007 Aug;41(4):221-9. PMID: 17680509
citations.BibTeX: @article{17680509, title={Prevention of ventricular fibrillation requires central beta-adrenoceptor blockade in rabbits.}, author={Ablad B and Bjurö T and Björkman JA and Edström T}, journal={Scand Cardiovasc J}, volume={41}, number={4}, pages={221-9}}

results.title: Prophylaxis of ventricular fibrillation after acute experimental coronary occlusion by chronic beta-adrenoceptor blockade with atenolol.
results.text_hl: Prophylaxis of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular fibrillation@@@ after acute experimental @DISEASE_Coronary_Occlusion @DISEASE_MESH:D054059 @@@coronary occlusion@@@ by chronic beta-adrenoceptor blockade with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Menken U, Wiegand V, Bucher P, Meesmann W. Prophylaxis of ventricular fibrillation after acute experimental coronary occlusion by chronic beta-adrenoceptor blockade with atenolol. Cardiovasc Res. 1979 Oct;13(10):588-94. PMID: 519661
citations.BibTeX: @article{519661, title={Prophylaxis of ventricular fibrillation after acute experimental coronary occlusion by chronic beta-adrenoceptor blockade with atenolol.}, author={Menken U and Wiegand V and Bucher P and Meesmann W}, journal={Cardiovasc Res}, volume={13}, number={10}, pages={588-94}}

results.title: Atenolol in combination with epinephrine improves the initial outcome of cardiopulmonary resuscitation in a swine model of ventricular fibrillation.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ in combination with @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@epinephrine@@@ improves the initial outcome of cardiopulmonary resuscitation in a @SPECIES_9823 @@@swine@@@ model of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular fibrillation@@@.

citations.NLM: Bassiakou E, Xanthos T, Koudouna E, Goulas S, Prapa V, Papadimitriou D, Rokas G, Papadimitriou L. Atenolol in combination with epinephrine improves the initial outcome of cardiopulmonary resuscitation in a swine model of ventricular fibrillation. Am J Emerg Med. 2008 Jun;26(5):578-84. PMID: 18534288
citations.BibTeX: @article{18534288, title={Atenolol in combination with epinephrine improves the initial outcome of cardiopulmonary resuscitation in a swine model of ventricular fibrillation.}, author={Bassiakou E and Xanthos T and Koudouna E and Goulas S and Prapa V and Papadimitriou D and Rokas G and Papadimitriou L}, journal={Am J Emerg Med}, volume={26}, number={5}, pages={578-84}}

results.title: Ischemia- and reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in conscious rats--studies with prazosin and atenolol.
results.text_hl: Beta-adrenoceptor blockade with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (1 mg/kg body weight) significantly reduced the incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular fibrillation@@@ to 17% (p less than 0.05).

citations.NLM: Kinoshita K, Hearse DJ, Braimbridge MV, Manning AS. Ischemia- and reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in conscious rats--studies with prazosin and atenolol. Jpn Circ J. 1988 Dec;52(12):1384-94. PMID: 3241320
citations.BibTeX: @article{3241320, title={Ischemia- and reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in conscious rats--studies with prazosin and atenolol.}, author={Kinoshita K and Hearse DJ and Braimbridge MV and Manning AS}, journal={Jpn Circ J}, volume={52}, number={12}, pages={1384-94}}

results.title: Different effects of fosinopril and atenolol on wave reflections in hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: We conducted this study to compare the effects of @CHEMICAL_Fosinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017328 @@@fosinopril@@@ versus @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on peripheral blood pressure, central arterial wave reflection, and left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ mass in a group of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Essential_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000075222 @@@essential hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Chen CH, Ting CT, Lin SJ, Hsu TL, Yin FC, Siu CO, Chou P, Wang SP, Chang MS. Different effects of fosinopril and atenolol on wave reflections in hypertensive patients. Hypertension. 1995 May;25(5):1034-41. PMID: 7737712
citations.BibTeX: @article{7737712, title={Different effects of fosinopril and atenolol on wave reflections in hypertensive patients.}, author={Chen CH and Ting CT and Lin SJ and Hsu TL and Yin FC and Siu CO and Chou P and Wang SP and Chang MS}, journal={Hypertension}, volume={25}, number={5}, pages={1034-41}}

results.title: Reoxygenation dysrhythmias in the isolated guinea-pig heart: sensitivity to prazosin, atenolol and practolol.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Prazosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011224 @@@Prazosin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ were able to reduce significantly the incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular fibrillation@@@ and LDH release.

citations.NLM: Antonini G, Franconi F, Giotti A, Ledda F, Mantelli L, Stendardi I. Reoxygenation dysrhythmias in the isolated guinea-pig heart: sensitivity to prazosin, atenolol and practolol. Pharmacol Res Commun. 1983 Sep;15(8):751-63. PMID: 6634908
citations.BibTeX: @article{6634908, title={Reoxygenation dysrhythmias in the isolated guinea-pig heart: sensitivity to prazosin, atenolol and practolol.}, author={Antonini G and Franconi F and Giotti A and Ledda F and Mantelli L and Stendardi I}, journal={Pharmacol Res Commun}, volume={15}, number={8}, pages={751-63}}

results.title: Independent contribution of catecholamines to arrhythmogenesis during evolving infarction in the isolated rat heart.
results.text_hl: The mechanisms of phase 2 @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@VF@@@ are not established.

citations.NLM: Clements-Jewery H, Hearse DJ, Curtis MJ. Independent contribution of catecholamines to arrhythmogenesis during evolving infarction in the isolated rat heart. Br J Pharmacol. 2002 Feb;135(3):807-15. PMID: 11834629
citations.BibTeX: @article{11834629, title={Independent contribution of catecholamines to arrhythmogenesis during evolving infarction in the isolated rat heart.}, author={Clements-Jewery H and Hearse DJ and Curtis MJ}, journal={Br J Pharmacol}, volume={135}, number={3}, pages={807-15}}

results.title: Facilitation of ischaemia-induced ventricular fibrillation by catecholamines is mediated by beta1 and beta2 agonism in the rat heart in vitro.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Butoxamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002078 @@@butoxamine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_trimazosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C005185 @@@trimazosin@@@ did not affect @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@VF@@@ at concentrations with beta1 -, beta2 - or alpha1 - adrenoceptor specificity and selectivity (confirmed in separate @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ aortae myography experiments).

citations.NLM: Wilder CDE, Pavlaki N, Dursun T, Gyimah P, Caldwell-Dunn E, Ranieri A, Lewis HR, Curtis MJ. Facilitation of ischaemia-induced ventricular fibrillation by catecholamines is mediated by beta1 and beta2 agonism in the rat heart in vitro. Br J Pharmacol. 2018 May;175(10):1669-1690. PMID: 29473948

results.title: Relative Importance of Aortic Stiffness and Volume as Predictors of Treatment-Induced Improvement in Left Ventricular Mass Index in Dialysis
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@Hypertension@@@ in Hemodialysis @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ Treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Lisinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ trial compared the effect of @CHEMICAL_Lisinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ versus @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in reducing left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ mass index; 179 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with echo measurements of aortic pulse wave velocity and left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ mass at baseline were included.

citations.NLM: Georgianos PI, Agarwal R. Relative Importance of Aortic Stiffness and Volume as Predictors of Treatment-Induced Improvement in Left Ventricular Mass Index in Dialysis PLoS One. 2015;10(9):e0135457. PMID: 26356419
citations.BibTeX: @article{26356419, title={Relative Importance of Aortic Stiffness and Volume as Predictors of Treatment-Induced Improvement in Left Ventricular Mass Index in Dialysis}, author={Georgianos PI and Agarwal R}, journal={PLoS One}, volume={10}, number={9}, pages={e0135457}}
